title: At What Level Should One Cluster Standard Errors in Paired and Small-Strata Experiments?. (arXiv:1906.00288v10 [econ.EM] UPDATED)
abstract: In matched-pairs experiments in which one cluster per pair of clusters is assigned to treatment, to estimate treatment effects, researchers often regress their outcome on a treatment indicator and pair fixed effects, clustering standard errors at the unit-ofrandomization level. We show that even if the treatment has no effect, a 5%-level t-test based on this regression will wrongly conclude that the treatment has an effect up to 16.5% of the time. To fix this problem, researchers should instead cluster standard errors at the pair level. Using simulations, we show that similar results apply to clustered experiments with small strata.

translated_title: 在配对和小层次实验中，应该在哪个层次上对标准误差进行聚类？
translated_abstract: 在配对实验中，研究人员通常通过将结果回归到治疗指示器和配对固定效应，并在随机化单元层次上聚类标准误差来估计治疗效应。我们表明，即使治疗没有效果，基于该回归的5%水平t检验会错误地得出治疗存在效应的结论，错误率可高达16.5%。为解决这个问题，研究人员应该将标准误差聚类在配对层次上。通过模拟，我们发现类似的结果也适用于具有小层次的聚类实验。
tldr: 在配对和小层次实验中，研究人员发现，将标准误差聚类在随机化单元层次上会导致高达16.5%的错误结论。为解决这个问题，他们应该将标准误差聚类在配对层次上。
en_tdlr: In paired and small-strata experiments, researchers found that clustering standard errors at the unit-of-randomization level can lead to error conclusions up to 16.5%. To fix this problem, they should instead cluster standard errors at the pair level.
